Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a land habitat, such as a playground, garden, forest, or parking lot.
The student can draw a water habitat, such as a pond, stream, or lake.
The student can include various living things in the land habitat, like trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, and ants.
The student can include various living things in the water habitat, like fish and clams.
The student can make comparisons by showing differences in the types of living things found in the land habitat versus the water habitat.
The student can illustrate patterns of how plants and animals are diverse across different habitats.
